thesis.description: [...] Dans le premier chapitre on considérera des fautes lexicologiques qui n'embrassent que des mots ou des expressions isolés puis dans le deuxième chapitre on discutera des fautes d'interprétation qui ont plus d'importance. Sous les deux titres on retrouvera dee Inexactitudes sémantiques en plue des irexactitudee stylistiques. Tandis que les fautes rassemblées dans le premier chapitre sont faciles à reconnaître et à analyser, celles du deuxième devienaent plus complexes.[...]

thesis.description: [...] The chief objects of the present investigation are: 1. Continuation of the detailed study of glycolysis in blood. 2. To ascertain whether glucose is the sole source of pyruvic acid formed in the red blood cells during storage. 3. To determine the reason for certain fluctuations observed by Mrs. Andreae in the copper-reducing values of protein-free filtrates of preserved blood containing added dextrose. 4. To ascertain whether there is any relation between the loss of viability of the red blood cell and its glycolytic state.

thesis.description: The problem of hypertension and its relation to the kidney, and lesions throughout the vascular tree has excited considerable interest since the days of Richard Bright. In the human, hypertension may be associated with changes in the arterioles generally, although Chiefly in the kidneys but frequently the picture of hypertension may be present without the expected pathological findings. Severe degrees of arteriösclerosis may be found in chronic hypertension but again this is not a constant feature.[...]
thesis.creator: Kipkie, G.F.
thesis.subject: Pathology.
thesis.title: The vascular lesions of renal hypertension in the rabbit.

thesis.description: L'oeuvre dramatique de Gide est assez mince, cependant l'intdret qu'il a porte au theätre nfa jamais cesse durant toute sa carriere. Nous en trouvons des signes dans ses traductions de Shakespeare, dans ses commentaires sur l'oeuvre de tel ou tel dramaturge, sur l1Interpretation des grands roles, ou meme dans des discours sur l'art du theätre comme cette Evolution du theätre auquel nous aurons souvent recours.[...]

thesis.description: [...] Up to the present, there does not appear to be available an anemometer capable of measuring wind velocities over a wide ränge with a fair degree of accuracy which is suitable to general meteorological use. It is the intention of this thesis to indicate how this may be accomplished, making use of a principle entirely removed from those outlined in the preceding paragraphs.

thesis.description: The ever increasing industrial utilization of numerous organic liquids for condensation purposes in a vast multitude of processes is a fact which makes the determination of condensing vapor film coefficients a virtual necessity. Such observations are, of course, of primary interest to designers of heat transfer equipment. Since any discussion of condensing vapors is intimately associated with the film concept, it would be well to devote some space to the history of this concept. [...]
thesis.creator: Kemmett, Francis Weldon.
thesis.subject: Chemical Engineering.
thesis.title: The determination of film coefficients for condensing vapors.

thesis.description: [...] In the investigations to be described an attempt was made to obtain a chronic epileptic animal through the prolonged accumulation or potentiation of acetylcholine in the cerebrum by injecting the anticholinesterase di-isopropyl fluorophosphate (DFP), the action of which is almost irreversible, into the carotid artery of cats. It was hoped to restrict the action of this potent chemical to the brain, or even to one hemisphere of the brain, and thus to avoid most of the peripheral systemic effects of the drug.[...]
thesis.creator: Kelen, A.
thesis.subject: Neurology, Neurosurgery.
thesis.title: Studies on the role of acetylcholine in experimental seizures.

Brief treatments are given of cases (b) and (c).[...]

thesis.description: The synthesis of long chain carbon Compounds of known molecular weight is of interest in the field of high polymers, in connection with molecular weight determinations by comparative methods. Such Compounds should prove useful as Standards in calibrating this type of molecular weight determination apparatus. The electrochemical oxidation of dicarboxylic acids is a possible method for the synthesis of straight chain Compounds of high molecular weight. The purpose of the present investigation was to determine the limits to which this synthesis could be carried in order to yield pure high molecular weight Compounds in reasonable quantities.
thesis.creator: Jeffrey, Claire Osborn.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The electrosynthesis of long chain dicarboxylic acids.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: [...] In order to throw further light upon the exact nature of this polymer-thiol interaction, it was felt that it would be of interest to carry out a careful study of the role of atmospheric oxygen and other oxidizing agents whioh may be present in Systems of this kind. The work presented in this thesis, therefore, represents a study of these factors in the interaction of polybutadiene and polystyrene with a thiol in an emulsion medium.
thesis.creator: Jardine, John McNair.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The behavior of tertiary hexadecanethiol in polymer-emulsion systems.

thesis.description: The objeet of this study is to discover whether there are common factors in the personality structures of truant and delinquent boys. It will also attempt to answer the following related questions: 1. What is the relation of truancy to the more serious forms of delinquency -- is it merely a preliminary stage or does it spring from different causes? 2. What are the specific emotional disturbances that find expression in truancy and delinquency? 3. What common intellectual patterns are found in the truant group that might account for maladjustment to the school Situation? [...]
thesis.creator: Irvine, Lucille.
thesis.subject: School attendance.
Juvenile delinquents -- Psychology.
Teenage boys -- Psychology.
thesis.title: Personality structures of truant and delinquent boys.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

Since this concentration and acidity also approximates the conditions used in plant practice, it was chosen as the electrolyte to be used in this study.

thesis.description: During the first world war it was initially believed that a country's wae effort was determined by its financial strength, of which the first factor was the gold reserve. And it was concluded that, because Germany's gold reserves were small, the war effort of that country would soon be exhausted, the war over quickly and, consequently, it was unwise to disturb the economic structure of countries at war for such a temporary event. "Business as usual". Moreover, reparations would indemnify the winner for all losses.[...]
thesis.creator: Van Holsbeek, Henry M. A.
thesis.subject: Finance, Public -- Canada.
War, Cost of.
thesis.title: Canada’s financial system in war and reconstruction.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A history of ichthyology in the North American Arctic reveals the very subordinate position which it has. occupied to many other lines of endeavor. This can be explained by the fact, that even today there are no commercial fisheries in the arctic except in Greenland, and secondly the interest of early Europeans was directed toward the discovery of precious minerals and a short route to the riches of the far east. Since ichthyology has occupied this minor role, nearly all accounts of fishes are included in the narrative or appendices, as brief incidental items to the main story or purpose of the exploration. For.this reason this paper will start with a review of some of the more important expeditions in the Canadian Arctic. [...]
thesis.creator: Hildebrand, Henry Herman.
thesis.subject: Marine fishes -- Canada.
thesis.title: Marine fish of arctic Canada.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Definite synergistic effects were noted by the use of a combination of sulfathiazole with penicillin and sulfathiazole with streptomycin. The growth of small numbers of cells (10 — 50) of sixteen species of Salmonella v/as inhibited by the synergistic activity of these antibacterial substances when a semisolid medium was used. Sulfathiazole alone, In sublethal amounts was able to inhibit the motility of all the flagellated species tested. The growth of the motile organisms in the semisolid medium in the presence of sulfathiazole appeared as "multiple granules" in comparison to the single-colony growth of the non-motile species. A new method for determining the most effective combination of any two antibacterial substances against any given sensitive organism is described. An attempt to demonstrate an in vivo synergistic activity in S. pullorum infected chicks was not successful under the conditions of the experiment.
thesis.creator: Herman, Lloyd George Henry.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Bacteriology.
thesis.title: The synergistic action of penicillin, streptomycin and various sulfonamides on certain gram-negative bacteria.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Lens-rupture, the eye anomaly discussed in this thesis was first observed in 1946 by Dr. F. C. Fräser in the F2 of a cross between the albino A strain and an inbred albino stock homozygous for the flexed tail (f) gene. Observations of the parent strains showed the flexed tail albino stock to be similarly affected. The condition is termed lens-rupture because it involves extrusion of the nucleus of the lens, through a rupture in the lens capsule, into the vitreous Chamber of the eye.
thesis.creator: Herer, Moe Lionel.
thesis.subject: Mice -- Genetics.
thesis.title: Lens-rupture; a new recessive gene in the mouse.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Comparisons 1ith the National Bureau of Standards at Washington, D.C. in January, 1948, have indicated that a reference mean of electromotive force can be recaptured even after a period of forty years to within twenty microvolts. This has been accomplished with unexpectedly high precision by application of a previously established ageing correction to the mean electromotive force of a small number of old cells. Confirmation is provided, of the validity of the ageing correction which is of the form: EM, = A + B'log (M + T), where A, B, and T are constants, and M is the age of the reference cells.
thesis.creator: Henrikson, Arne.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Maintenance of precision standards of electromotive force.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of the following study is twofold. It seeks primarily to present a workable key to the species of the genus Septis for the use of students of the Phalaenidae. The lepidopterist is dependent, to a considerable extent, upon a large reference collection in the determination of material. Such collections, however, are not always accessible to the worker, especially the amateur. In the absence of such a collection the student is forced to rely on keys. In the past, subfamily and generic keys have been based largely either on venation or on such characters as spining of the tibiae, hairiness of the eyes, structure and vestiture of the palpi,etc. Keys based largely on venational characters such as those found in Forbes's Lepidoptera of New York and Neighbouring States, are rendered useless to a large degree by the scaling of the wings, unless the specimen be destroyed to make a suitable venational mount. [...]
thesis.creator: Hardwick, David Francis.
thesis.subject: Entomology.
thesis.title: A systematic study of the external male genitalia of the Genus Septis (Lepidoptera Phalaenidae).
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In undertaking a study of the case work process involved in helping the child to participate in his move in to an adoption home, the writer hopes to be able to clarify her own thinking and philosophy concerning this phase of adoption. It will also be a means of evaluating the skill and technique which she has been able to develop in this process. An attempt will be made t o bring out many of the beliefs and convictions, concerning a child's capacities, growth and development, which the writer feels are basic to a social worker, if she is to sustain her role as a helping person in the placement process. These have been formulated from the writings of many of the outstanding child psychologists, psychiatrists and social workers in the child welfare field. To what extent the writer has been able to integrate these and actually utilize them in her own field work practice will be evident in the case studies presented. [...]
thesis.creator: Harbison, Irene.
thesis.subject: Older child adoption.
thesis.title: How the child can be helped to participate in his move into an adoption home.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Examination of the widely-accepted statement that signals weaker than thermal noise are useless shows it to be inadequate. By definition of information transfer in terms of probability theory, and application of Bayes' Theorem, a new general formula for the information which can be received in a given bandwidth and time in the presence of any amount of noise is obtained. Some special cases and deductions follow, one of which is that signals weaker than thermal noise are not useless. Consideration is given to the design of a weak-signal detector, operating on changes of distribution produced in some property of the noise by the presence of signals. Experimental operation of such a statistical detector is roported for signal-to-noise ratios of less than one. Early papers on radio noise are discussed briefly: the bibliography is .extensive. Improvement of maximum radar ranges on small targets is suggested among the problems for further research.
thesis.creator: Hall, James Stonely.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: Radio signals masked by noise.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the examination of the text the prose and verse are considered separately indifferent chapters, but the points brought forth are similar in both. In discussing the literalness of the translation, omissions, textual deviat ions and other departures observed in Rossetti's rendition are noted and studied. It is also examined with respect to the translator's principle of fidelity, and the merits of the work are duly acknowledged. Up to the present Rossetti's translations have remained over-shadowed by the author's other brilliant accomplishments. I have undertaken, therefore, the present study as a step towards the fuller recognition of Rossetti's merits as a translator.
thesis.creator: Guardo, Lea Carmela.
thesis.subject: Dante Alighieri, 1265-1321. Vita nuova.
Rossetti, Dante Gabriel, 1828-1882.
thesis.title: Dante Gabriel Rosetti’s translation of Dante’s Vita nuova : theory and practice.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Chemical kinetics is one of the older branches of physical chemistry, and its subject matter is very large. For this reason, the historical introduction to be presented cannot be considered as a comprehensive review of the whole field of chemical kinetics. Rather, it serves to fit the work to be described in this thesis into the general background of chemical kinetics.[...]

thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Nitrogen atom reactions : A. Reaction of nitrogen atoms with ethylene. B. Application of diffusion flame techniques to the reaction between nitrogen atoms and ethylene.

thesis.description: The present investigation is entirely original in the sense that all results reported are based on the author's own work. Human and animal experiments reported by other authors on this subject have been either numerically insufficient or fail to allow the immunizing efficiency of the individual antigens in the combinations to be determined quantitatively. This investigation is unique in that the experiments were primarily designed to provide adequate data for significant statistical analysis. [...]
thesis.creator: Greenberg, L.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology.
thesis.title: The immunizing efficiency of mixed antigens.
